title: Qualcomm Snapdragon 810 gets Cat. 9 LTE support | Trusted Reviews
description:
![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Qualcomm has revealed that its fast-approaching[Snapdragon 810
chip](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/qualcomm-offers-a-glimpse-of-the-
future-with-snapdragon-810-developer-handset) will support Category 9 LTE
carrier aggregation.**

This means the chip’s modem boasts a theoretical maximum download speed of
450Mbps.

Qualcomm says it managed to achieve these blistering speeds during internal
tests with three LTE carriers, each with a bandwidth of up to 20MHz.

It also marks the Snapdragon as Qualcomm’s first application processor to
support Cat. 9 LTE.

Alex Katouzian, Qualcomm’s Senior VP of Product Management, said: “Qualcomm
Technologies continues to be a leader in the mobile industry with
commercialisation of the world’s leading modem technology, delivering fast and
reliable cellular data connectivity solutions.”

“This provides speedy application performance and feature richness across
greater coverage areas enabled by LTE Category 9 connectivity.”

He added: “With powerful processors like the Snapdragon 810, we look forward
to continuing to drive LTE innovation in the high tier to ensure exceptional
user experiences as mobile broadband demand grows.”

  * 

Qualcomm says its new chip will be available to customers in early 2015, and
has been rumoured to debut in the [Samsung Galaxy
S6](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/samsung-galaxy-s6-release-date-
rumours-news-specs-and-price), the [LG
G4](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/lg-g4-release-date-rumours-news-specs-
and-price), the [Sony Xperia Z4](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/sony-
xperia-z4-release-date-rumours-news-specs-and-price), and the [HTC One M9
Hima](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/htc-one-m9-release-date-rumours-
news-specs-and-price).

The chip-maker was also keen to point out that its LTE-Advanced modem would be
backwards compatible with ‘all major cellular standards’ including GSM, CDMA,
and HSPA+.

The news comes just days after Samsung was reported to be [working on its own
Exynos chip](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/samsung-galaxy-s6-to-land-
with-cat-10-lte-reports-suggest) capable of supporting Cat. 10 LTE.

The current top-tier LTE modem is Cat. 6, which caps out at about 300Mbps,
assuming your carrier will provide such generous data speeds.

It’s expected Samsung will release two variants of its Samsung Galaxy S6 – one
powered by the Snapdragon 810, and one powered by its custom-built Exynos
chip.

**Read More:** [Qualcomm refutes claims of Snapdragon 810
delays](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/qualcomm-refutes-claims-of-
snapdragon-810-delays)
